FuncDef:
The delay-measure two-way receive command enables DM frame reception on the remote MEP to implement the two-way frame delay measurement.
The undo delay-measure two-way receive command removes the configuration of DM frame reception from the remote MEP.
By default, DM frame reception is not configured on the remote MEP in an MA.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the ID of a test instance.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4294967295.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
After you configure on-demand two-way frame delay measurement using the delay-measure two-way send command and proactive two-way frame delay measurement using the delay-measure two-way continual send command, you must run the flow-name delay-measure two-way receive command to enable the DMM reception function.
Prerequisites
The delay-measure two-way receive command takes effect only after the following configurations are complete:
Run the cfm version standard command in the system view to specify IEEE Standard 802.1ag-2007 for CFM.The CFM function is enabled globally by using the cfm enable command in the system view.An MD is created by using the cfm md command in the system view.An MA is created by using the ma command in the MD view.An inward-facing MEP has been created using the mep mep-id command in the MA view.A remote MEP in the MA is created by using the remote-mep command in the MA view.A test instance in the MA is created by using the test-id command in the MA view.
